title: Understanding the Problem Statement
text: Before you start writing, think about what the problem is asking. Are you comfortable with the topic? Do you have a clear understanding of the question?

title: Choosing a Starting Point
text: Consider starting with the part of the problem you understand best. This can help build confidence and make the rest of the problem easier to tackle.

title: Organizing Your Thoughts
text: Break down the problem into smaller, manageable parts. This can help you focus on one aspect at a time and avoid feeling overwhelmed.

title: Reviewing Your Work
text: After writing your initial thoughts, review them to ensure they align with the problem statement. Make adjustments if necessary.
